description: Roman Villa estate, finds suggest that there was likely a religious character to the site, and so a shrine is interpreted to have been on the site.
bibliography: Draper, J. “Excavations at Hill Farm, Gestingthorpe, Essex.” East Anglian Archaeology 25 (1985).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Hill Farm, Gestingthorpe (Essex).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
